intro: Thymus quinquecostatus var. magnus, commonly known as the giant thyme, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its dense, fragrant foliage and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm, with hairy, narrow leaves that are aromatic when crushed. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is complemented by its use in culinary and medicinal applications.
